overview.label: Project overview
paragraphs: This Newquay project was a complete front garden transformation completed over just 2–3 days. The homeowner had struggled to keep on top of the space for over a year and wanted a solution that looked great without demanding constant upkeep.
We cleared the area back, removed tired planting and built-up weeds, and then prepared the ground properly so the new finish would last.

The end result is a clean, low-maintenance gravel garden that looks tidy from the street, feels easier to manage day-to-day, and gives the homeowner pride (instead of stress) every time they come home.

faq.question: Why choose a gravel garden for low maintenance?
faq.answer: Gravel gardens require minimal upkeep, suppress weeds, and provide a clean, modern look. They’re perfect for anyone who wants a beautiful space without the stress of constant gardening.

faq.question: How long did the transformation take?
faq.answer: The entire project was completed in just 2-3 days, including clearing, preparation, and installation.

faq.question: Can you create a similar garden for me?
faq.answer: Absolutely! We specialise in low-maintenance transformations tailored to your needs. Get in touch for a free quote.

faq.question: Will weeds come back through the gravel?
faq.answer: Good ground preparation and a proper weed-suppression layer can dramatically reduce weeds. Over time, some surface weeds can still appear from wind-blown seeds, but they’re usually quick to remove and far less work than a traditional bed.

faq.question: How do I maintain a gravel garden?
faq.answer: Gravel gardens are easy to maintain: occasional raking, removing leaves/debris, and topping up gravel when needed will keep it looking tidy. If you want, we can also provide an ongoing maintenance plan.
